metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3472 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in xorg-x11-server in versions before 1.20.11. An integer underflow can occur in xserver which can lead to a local privilege escalation. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity as well as system availability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3472` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

xdmx - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.9
xdmx-tools - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.9
xmir - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.9
xnest - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.9
xorg-server-source - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.9
xserver-common - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.9
xserver-xephyr - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.9
xserver-xorg-core - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.9
xserver-xorg-legacy - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.9
xserver-xorg-xmir - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.9
xvfb - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.9
xwayland - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

xorg-server-source-hwe-18.04 - 2:1.20.8-2ubuntu2.2~18.04.5
